text: A soft answer will turn away wrath,
but a word of trouble will stir ⸤anger⸥.\f + \fr 15:1 \ft Literally “nostril” \f*
The tongue of the wise will dispense knowledge,
but the mouth of fools will pour out folly.
In every place, the eyes of Yahweh
keep watch over the evil and the good.
Gentleness\f + \fr 15:4 \ft Or “Healing” \f* of tongue is a tree of life,
but perverseness in it\f + \fr 15:4 \ft That is, the tongue \f* \add causes\add* a break in spirit.
A fool will despise the instruction of his father,
but he who guards reproof is prudent.
\add In\add* the house of the righteous \add there is\add* much treasure,
but the income of the wicked brings trouble.
The lips of the wise will spread knowledge,
but the heart\f + \fr 15:7 \ft Or “mind” \f* of fools, not so.
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination of Yahweh,
but the prayer of the upright \add is\add* his delight.
An abomination of Yahweh is the way of the wicked,
but he who pursues righteousness he will love.
Severe discipline \add belongs\add* to him who forsakes the way;
he who hates a rebuke will die.

Sheol\f + \fr 15:11 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f* and Abaddon\f + \fr 15:11 \ft Poetic synonym for “Sheol.” Only mentioned in the \sc ot\sc* in relation to Sheol, the grave, or death. \f* \add are\add* before Yahweh,
⸤how much more⸥\f + \fr 15:11 \ft Literally “more for” \f* the hearts of the children of men!
A scoffer does not like ⸤his rebuke⸥;\f + \fr 15:12 \ft Literally “rebuke \fq belonging \ft to him” \f*
to the wise he will not go.
A heart\f + \fr 15:13 \ft Or “mind” \f* of gladness will make good ⸤countenance⸥,\f + \fr 15:13 \ft Literally “faces” \f*
but in sorrow of heart\f + \fr 15:13 \ft Or “mind” \f* a spirit is broken.
The heart of him who understands will seek knowledge,
but the faces of fools, they\f + \fr 15:14 \ft Hebrew “he/it” \f* will feed on folly.
All the days of the poor \add are\add* hard,
but goodness of heart\f + \fr 15:15 \ft Or “mind” \f* \add is\add* a continuous feast.
Better \add is\add* little with the fear of Yahweh
than great treasure and trouble with it.\f + \fr 15:16 \ft Or “him” \f*
Better \add is\add* a dinner of vegetables when\f + \fr 15:17 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* love \add is\add* there
than a fattened ox and hatred with it.\f + \fr 15:17 \ft Or “him” \f*
A man who is hot-tempered will stir up strife,
but he who is slow \add to\add* ⸤anger⸥,\f + \fr 15:18 \ft Literally “nostrils” \f* he will calm contention.
The way of the lazy is like a hedge of thorns,\f + \fr 15:19 \ft Hebrew “thorn” \f*
but the path of the upright \add is\add* a highway.
A child of wisdom will make a father glad,
but a ⸤foolish person⸥,\f + \fr 15:20 \ft Literally “foolishness of humankind” \f* he despises his mother.
Folly is a joy to him who lacks ⸤sense⸥,\f + \fr 15:21 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
and a person of understanding ⸤will walk upright⸥.\f + \fr 15:21 \ft Literally “he will walk upright walking” \f*
Plans go wrong when there is no counsel,
but with many advisors it will succeed.
Joy \add belongs\add* to a man with answers in his mouth,
and a word in its time, how good \add it is\add*!
The path of life \add leads\add* upward for him who has insight,
in order to turn away from Sheol below.
The house of the proud, Yahweh will tear \add it\add* down,
but he will maintain the ⸤property line⸥\f + \fr 15:25 \ft Literally “boundary” \f* of the widow.
Plans of evil \add are\add* an abomination of Yahweh,
but gracious words are pure.
He who makes trouble for his house \add is\add* he who is greedy for unjust gain,
but he who hates bribes will live.
A heart\f + \fr 15:28 \ft Or “mind” \f* of righteousness will ponder the answer,
but a mouth of wickedness will pour out deceit.
Yahweh is far from the wicked,
but the prayers of the righteous he will hear.
From the light of the eyes, the heart\f + \fr 15:30 \ft Or “mind” \f* will rejoice,
and good news will enliven the bones.\f + \fr 15:30 \ft Hebrew “bone” \f*
The ear of him who listens \add to\add* admonitions of life,
in the midst of the wise it will lodge.
He who ignores instruction despises himself,\f + \fr 15:32 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f*
but he who hears admonition gains heart.\f + \fr 15:32 \ft Or “mind” \f*
Fear of Yahweh \add is\add* the instruction of the wise,
and before honor \add comes\add* humility.
